Reviews.Title: “Great Family Holiday”
Reviews.Author: NeilJ_12Edinburgh
Reviews.Content: Just back from Madrid and we had a great time. The hotel has a good( but quiet) location, right beside the Arguiles Metro Station that has two great routes to all the main tourist areas and provides easy access to many others. Just a few minutes walking from the Temple of Debod and the Parque del Ouste, 15 minutes walk to the plaza Espana and Gran Via and across the road from Zara, Mango and El Corte Ingles where you can shop to your hearts content. Very clean and well laid out the fully air-conditioned room was ideal for our needs. The staff are friendly and helpful at all times and were really nice to our children, especially since none of us are great Spanish speakers. Did not have breakfast at the hotel as we liked to be out before the sun got too hot but there were many other local options around if required. If you are staying be sure to use the roof terrace, it's almost a secret. It was hardly used while we were there but is wonderful for sunbathing or lovely and cool for a drink on a warm summers evening and has amazing views across Madrid and the surrounding area. Hope to return again and would definitely stay here again if in Madrid

Reviews.Title: “good and bad”
Reviews.Author: Birdparker
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 days with husband and young children to be nearby for a family christening - the layout and finish of the rooms was of a high quality, however a few things were lacking. Aircon was terrible, virtually non-existent and from other reviews this appears to be the norm for some rooms. My daughter's bed was a pull out which had a low shelf directly above that she would hit her head on if she attempted to sit up in bed! No tea/coffee in the room which may be normal for spain and the tv was obviously all spanish channels. Seems to be a trend at hotels now to include the absolute minimum of notepad paper in rooms, this was no exception. bathroom was fine but shower temperature extremely difficult to control so a frustrating experience all round. No fridge either which is a big problem considering the no aircon and the outside temp. Downstairs had free pc with internet but only one which was inevitably always in use. Breakfast was fine although all continental, nothing hot/cooked. All in all it was fine - just fine - but i've stayed in much better hotels in my time. Would search for alternative options if i had to stay in the area again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: AnAmericanintheUK
Reviews.Content: The hotel is spacious and clean, with a modern feel to it. I really enjoyed the layout of my room, which was open, with a nice bathroom, bed, and desk, and light hardwood floors. Not much of a view out to the city, but fine. The location is also good, within walking distance of many sites and good restaurants, and less than a block from the metro. The staff were fine, but not particularly friendly. The main downside was that the air conditioning seemed a little weak, and had to run constantly. In the middle of my last night it broke, and the room heated up. I solved the temperature problem by opening the window, but that created a sound problem, as it seems the Madrid nightlife doesn't die down until 5am! But overall my stay was quite pleasant, and the room was worth the very reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Good decent stay”
Reviews.Author: ruchikakumar
Reviews.Content: A basic simple hotel with clean, neat rooms with efficient staff and good amenities. The kids enjoyed the bunk beds and the lovely sketches on the wall . Breakfast was nice with a few choices but pretty satisfactory. Location was pretty central and great shopping choices right next door.

Reviews.Title: “The Best of The 4 We stayed In”
Reviews.Author: Clubess1
Reviews.Content: We spent only one night at this small-ish hotel before our return flight to the States, but if a very friendly and informative front desk staff, a refreshingly airy and artistic lobby, a generous and varied breakfast in a dining room with warm wood tones and an outdoor patio, a tastefully furnished and adequately sized room were sufficient to impress us in one day, then we feel nearly anyone will be equally impressed. Its only shortcoming, if you are looking for a centrally located hotel, is that it is in the Arguelles neighborhood, not far from Complutense University of Madrid, so, walking up Gran Via and La Princesa would take a good half hour or more from Plaza Mayor and Puerta del Sol (but it's half an hour or more of great people watching, historical architecture, and window shopping!). On the other hand, it is a slightly more residential, quieter, and safe-feeling neighborhood with lots of college and high school students chatting and lazing about. It is also near the #6, and kind of near the #4 Metro lines (Arguelles station). This hotel is very family-friendly: there is a front desk area devoted to kids, with stuffed animals on nearby shelves, and the breakfast room has a kids' area with pint-sized bowls, plates, donuts and cereals. A bowl of apples is available in the lobby for snacking. There is a gym here, which you usually only find in high-end hotels so you can work off all those pasteles, tapas, and cervezas! We stayed in 3 other hotels during our trip through Portugal and Spain and, although each of them was perfectly acceptable, we all agreed that the T3 Tirol was the best and a perfect way to end a great vacation!

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: sara m
Reviews.Content: very good and confortable hotel. very closed to the middle of the town and metro is 50 m far. there are not a lot of sweet food for breakfast...but it is not so important. rooms are big and clean, very confortable for kids, there are toys and pistures on the wall on their beds!

Reviews.Title: “Nicely located by rather minimal”
Reviews.Author: archimidis
Reviews.Content: The hotel biggest asset is to be within walking distance from the historical center and all major shopping and restaurant facilities of Madrid. The rooms are unfortunately rather small with little space to seat and work. Those located in the rear of the building are lacking light. The buffet breakfast is quite disappointing. The staff is friendly and competent.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: Hikmatcalipso
Reviews.Content: Me & My beautiful wife was intending to visit Madrid during last September to spend our second honeymoon, and we were searching on the internet for a nice hotel in the city center, we have found T3 hotel in travel advisor and we decided to book. Believe me it was a very nice decision, since we found the hotel very clean and nice and the rooms with a good space, and the most important in the location, where you can easily go to any point in the city using the metro (we have found that Madrid’s metro is one of the best in the world) Also the breakfast is delicious and we felt like home.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: Mobeadz
Reviews.Content: Our group of 18 people stayed here for World Youth Day. Great location, clean hotel, and friendly and helpful staff. Half block away from the metro; good shopping in area, and good restaurants in area too. Would recommend this hotel to anyone going to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “I will definitely use this hotel again”
Reviews.Author: ogurel59
Reviews.Content: Location and transportation alternatives to/from the center and main attractions were great. Hotel staff were thoughtful, well-informed and helpful. Size of the room was good and equipment except for the minibar/fridge (there wasn't any) and air condition system were good. Breakfast cannot be described as excellent but was more than enough. It was also good to have our coffee after breakfast in the patio. There was not a minibar/fridge in the room, and we couldn't have a chance to keep our own refreshments cold. If you need a cold refreshment (except for the beer) you have to get out of the room and walk to the vending machine equipped each floor. You have to pay for internet for each user/device since this was not a customer friendly approach. In addition, you have to pay 1€ for each time you lock and open the safe in the room. Television channels were only in spanish.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel charges twice!!”
Reviews.Author: wmas
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the HOTEL TIROL in Madrid from May 31th to June 4rd. Since I was there with my family in January 2011 I thought that it would be nice to stay there again. So I made a reservation through the website DECOLAR.COM and was informed I would pay at the hotel and that my credit card would be given just for the reservation! I decided to pay in cash, what I did on the 3rd June and I have a receipt to prove it. As I came back to São Paulo I was very surprised to see that one night was charged in my credit card. So I'm complaining and trying to have my money back since then (almost one month!) and I still don't have any answer. I payed twice. How come the hotel doesn't notice that??? In addition I have to say that some people at the reception are not helpful at all and the room they gave me was also awful (with view to the fire stairs and dark). I had to pay 10 Euros more for each night to have a normal room. I think that is a terrible policy from the hotel, to give small and unpleasant rooms just because it was a single room!! I wait for a solution!!

Reviews.Title: “Very good three star hotel in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: theluxuriant
Reviews.Content: This is a very good option if you are coming to Madrid with kids. They have fantastic accommodations for them, either in your own room or in a separate kids bedroom attached to yours. Installations are comfortable, modern and clean (Ikea-like). Only problem is they need to fix their air conditioning as it was 100 degrees F in Madrid the weekend of our stay and the aircon just couldn't handle it. Also they have ridiculously fat pillows so make sure you bring your own if you are pillow-picky.

Reviews.Title: “Wanted to like it more but ...”
Reviews.Author: Buckaroo-8th
Reviews.Content: To begin with positives. Our room was quite spacious by European standards and included a separate little children's room which ours greatly enjoyed. The beds were comfortable and the property was clean and bright. The location, while not super central, is fine as well: there is a metro stop (with 3 lines) within one block, a department store/supermarket across the street, several reasonably priced restaurants/sandwich shops, and you can easily reach the Royal Palace by walking through the pleasant Parque del Oeste. The breakfast buffet had nice variety and was a good deal at 10 Euros per adult (if you prepay at check-in). The fitness room was surprisingly well equipped for a three star hotel and an internet terminal was available and worked well. Finally, the personel was always friendly and willing to help as much as they could. The big problem that was hard to look past was the air conditioning. It was simply inadequate (even when left on full blast constantly) to cool the room which was warm and stuffy, especially during the evening and early night. This made for poor sleeping conditions. The staff was sympathetic and offered us a different room but it didn't seem to be any better, just smaller. The hotel, while quite clean, as mentioned above, does seem in need of some refreshing to counter evident signs of wear and tear. Also, on arrival we found that only one bed was made for our boys. Even though we offered to do this ourselves, not much could be done because the maids were gone for the day and the reception had no access to clean sheets and could only offer us an extra pillow. We improvised and the bed was made the following day but the episode suggests poor planning by the hotel. The bottom line is that for the price that we paid, we probably could have done better.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel - Some Caveats”
Reviews.Author: puckbunnyLA
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Tirol in room 305 for a business trip in April 2011 for 8 nights. The hotel was close to our office (less than five minutes walking) and it is also within a block of the Arguelles metro station; you easily get around most of the city by going a few stops and changing lines. As a previous reviewer mentioned, the front desk service varied from person to person. The good: -- Location - while not in the heart of the city, it is in a nice, clean, safe neighborhood close to metro; convenient to our office -- Room was a corner room - was spacious and clean The bad: -- The room (facing Urquijo) was consistently noisy -- I can deal with that except: -- The air conditioning was non-existent (due to the noise, I couldn't keep the window open). Now I'll chalk this up to language differences but when I asked the front desk, I was told the hotel did not have air conditioning; a different colleague was told air conditioning is turned on later in the year; either way we all experienced some sleepless nights where the air was stifling but we couldn't open a window due to the noise -- The room doors didn't have the mechanism that lets them close softly; in the wee hours morning as people return from bars/restaurants I would be jolted awake by doors slamming shut -- The hotel charges 1 Euro for each usage of the safe -- If it matters to you - toiletries provided varied from room to room (I had body lotion + conditioner but a colleague was told no conditioner was supplied to any of the guests) The hotel is a good value for the price but there were some quirks that I could have done without. I've stayed at the Suites Viena previously and for the value, I found that a better hotel (rooms were more updated, location closer to Plaza de Espana etc). For my next trip where I need some solid nights sleep, I'll probably be booking elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent once again”
Reviews.Author: Trevvy2
Reviews.Content: Various members of our family have stayed here on numerous occasions. The staff are always very welcoming and helpful. Rooms are clean and bright. Book online on the Hotel’s website – seems to be cheaper than other brokers. Very close to Metro, and shops.

Reviews.Title: “Great value & location, just know the minor limitations"”
Reviews.Author: PlasticMoonRain
Reviews.Content: I brought my family here for a four night stay in Madrid. Since we were traveling with two young teens, we opted for the "family room," which was two pretty sizable beds pushed together for the adults, and a bunk bed for the two kids. The room was surprisingly a little bigger than I had expected, given that I'm always expecting something very cramped in Europe. But this was not the case here -- the kids loved their bunk bed and our beds were totally fine. Space was a little tight (biggest complaint: lack of drawer space for a 4-person room), but really we completely made due. The bathroom was totally fine as well. Every day when we returned, the room was spotless. While the hotel's location is not dead center in old Madrid or next to the Prado, it really did not matter. You are a block from the Arguelles metro station and you can get about anywhere within a couple of stops. As a matter of fact, on Christmas Day, my family and I walked straight down to Plaza D'Espana, the Royal Palace and then into the heart of Plaza Mayor... and it was truly a grand experience. The neighborhood is still quite nice. Every morning, my family and I went to Cafe Es Tea across the street for a simple inexpensive breakfast and off we went! The T3 Tirol offers tremendous value and we kept saying to ourselves: this is quite a deal. It was certainly more economical that we all stayed in the family room as opposed to splitting up into two separate doubles. However, there is a "Business Corner" right near the front desk where you can use the PC for free Internet access. The only minor quibble we had is that there is really no official "concierge" for a this hotel, and that would not be a big deal except for the fact that the quality of front desk help varies depending on who is on duty. Most of the folks who work the front desk were terrific. One of the front desk employees seemed to be from the "I don't know" camp. When we asked him for a suggestion of anyplace to eat around Plaza D'Espana, which is a 10 minute walk from the hotel, and he knew exactly where it was, he could not name one place. When my wife's ATM card was not returned from a local bank machine, my wife asked if he could call the bank to speak with them in Spanish to make sure they didn't do anything reckless with the card -- he refused (my wife asked a woman on another shift to do the same thing, and she couldn't have been more happier to do it). If you want to spend time in Madrid in a very nice and clean hotel with great value, I wouldn't hesitate to recommend the T3 Tirol.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: Umnome
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located. Near to metro stations and if you like walking, you can reach some good attractions by foot... The breakfast is good and they offer a special menu for children. The room and the bathroom are good. Clean and spacious. Free internet... We only have a problem with the air conditioning that was not working.

Reviews.Title: “Top class hotel, ideal for familys, well located”
Reviews.Author: justywint
Reviews.Content: Top class hotel. Very well located . Ideal for families with young kids. Attended a family wedding close to hotel. many shops and restaurants close by.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, convenient and safe except no free WIFI access”
Reviews.Author: jackykk
Reviews.Content: Very close to Arguelles metro station and the El Corte Ingles department store. Staff is nice and generally helpful. Surrounding area is safe and not noisy.

Reviews.Title: “A quiet and friendly hotel.”
Reviews.Author: GeertDB_10
Reviews.Content: Very well located for those who will use the Metro to explore Madrid. Near to the university. Quick and friendly service

Reviews.Title: “Good facilities in neighbourhood but service sucks”
Reviews.Author: Purplemang0
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel manager and some of the reception staff very rude and unhelpful. Once when we asked if we could use the microwave oven in the cafe (which was closed then) to heat up food, the manager huffed loudly, rolled up his eyes and threw up his hand in exasperation. It would be totally ok with me if he said no, but he responded the same way when I asked him a second time. We also asked the staff a few times if we could get some hot water, which the hotel room does not have, but they were quite unhelpful. It is alright if we cannot use the facilities, but the service attitude when responding to a guest does matter. The hotel room is small and basic, not spectacular, but clean and neat. It is a rather pleasant and neighbourhood, however, with the metro station, eateries, shops and shopping centre nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and clean”
Reviews.Author: Evanstonians
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three days. The rooms are clean and comfortable and the staff is very friendly. Also, the location is excellent. The arguelles metro station is just around the block and plaza mayor is within a 25 minutes walk. The breakfast is fairly good as well.

Reviews.Title: “Clean comfortable hotel, good quiet location - perfect for a weekend trip”
Reviews.Author: The2explorers28
Reviews.Content: Have just arrived home from a 3 day break in Madrid for a Hen Party. We were moved prior to our trip to the Hotel T3 Tirol after a pipe broke in our original hotel so we were not sure what to expect. However we were very pleased. The rooms are spacious and comfortable, very clean and whilst basic (for example - no fridge, no tea/coffee, only 1 english tv channel) it was absolutely perfect for our needs. Location was good, away from the main hub of the city but literally next to a metro stop and only about 4 stops from the centre of the action. You can buy 10 trips on the metro for 9 euros which was well worth it as walking around in the heat was not advisable. There is also a large supermarket opposite which was ideal for stocking up on water and snacks etc. Overall, we were very impressed and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service, great price and location”
Reviews.Author: Covisioner
Reviews.Content: The hotel manager gave us personal attention every day making sure the training event we put on there, and my personal stay was good. The entire staff helped us and adapted to our daily changing needs. The training room was small, but everything worked out with their help.

Reviews.Title: “acceptable”
Reviews.Author: fiastus
Reviews.Content: +: nice hotel, clean, new (looking new =)), comfortable, near center Madrid, underground station, quiet -: few TV channels, no Russian TV =)

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: chistorra
Reviews.Content: Ideally situated hotel near El Corte Ingles department store. Room was very clean and quiet. Friendly staff. We opted not to book a breakfast. On the opposite side street of the hotel there is a small baker shop which also serves breakfast. A croissant a coffee for just 2€! Just down the road on the same side of the hotel there is a small restaurants where the loclas come to eat. We ate menu del día, which included a three course meal and a glass of wine for 8€. La Gran Vía, Royal Palace and Sol are all within walking distance. An excellent hotel and certainly value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal with young children”
Reviews.Author: RJV01
Reviews.Content: The Family room was excellent: wide, large enough for a family of 5 and with an additional playroom with toys and a table to draw or play table games. They have a 120 sqmt playroom located at the 1st floor, where kids untired after touring Madrid and its museums, can burn the left energies. The location excellent: easy to drive in and out of the city, communicated by subway with any place in Madrid and in one of the best shopping areas. A nice park at walking distance. Parking available (few places) but there is a public parking at walking distance. Very serviceable staff. Excellent rate for the quality offered. The only minus: no free internet access and no cafeteria; but for breakfast with kids, when it is worthless to pay for the breakfast buffet, there are several coffee shops in front of the Hotel, where you get your coffee, muffin or toasts and orange juice for less than 3,50 Euro. It is worth to book in advance and benefit of the offers they make.

Reviews.Title: “I'll stay there next time!”
Reviews.Author: sparksLisbon
Reviews.Content: A really nice hotel located in nice neighborhood. It's a pitty that guests don't have access to a free internet connection...

Reviews.Title: “Well priced, residential location”
Reviews.Author: jcb193
Reviews.Content: Pros: Great rooms, nice bathrooms, spacious, modern. WELL PRICED. Close to metro. Cons: Charge for Wi-fi. In a residential area, so no restaurants after 10pm. Okay walk around area, but not much to see.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sumod8
Reviews.Content: I sayed at Hotel Tirol for two nights while attending a conference. All aI have is good comments. I asked the receptionist for a quiet room and was given the perfect place. The hotel is brand new, with all the necessary functionalities, but an additional touch of style and design that makes it unbeatable as regards value for money. I will come back!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Kelly64
Reviews.Content: Can't fault the hotel - rooms were very clean and bathroom very clean and large. Our room was on the inside so it was very quiet - just what we wanted. The hotel is located 150 yds from the Arguelles Metro line and was easy to find from the airport with only one change. Breakfast was a continental style with plenty of choice including lots of fresh fruit. We got a very good deal and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great location, super hotel and fantastic value for money”
Reviews.Author: YFetchati
Reviews.Content: I am just back from Madrid where I spent 5 nights at hotel tirol. This is actually the 2nd time I stay there and I think that it is absolutely great property and value for money. the hotel is 3* but outperform so many other 4* in madrid. I travel a lot and stay in hotels a lot, I will definitely not change my choice. what I liked is the ability to walk to Gan Via! I like the parquet wooden floors in the rooms, I like the free wifi although the connection could be a bit better. and of course, the breakfast is super. We were a group of us in the hotel and we had used a conference room facility which was really great as it had day light and we were able to use the patio for breaks. we had great service and will definitely recommend with no hesitation! Yahya Fetchati

Reviews.Title: “Terrible customer service”
Reviews.Author: CSD_9
Reviews.Content: I stayed 4 nights at the T3 Tirol Hotel and unfortunately even the hotel is clean, the rooms large and nice and the hotel itself very convenient located I have to rate this hotel as ''poor'' due to the dreadful service I have received. I work in Hotel business myself and to be honest I don't like to complain , but my complaint fell in deaf ears and even I asked for the Manager (Mr. Gonzales) to contact me, he was not bother. On my second night there at about 05.45 am I was woken up by a couple coming into my room. When they realized that the room is occupied they left, leaving the door wide open. To be honest I was afraid for my safety, I moved the table against the door and I rang Reception asking for an explanation. The girl in Reception was very rude and abrupt saying that she can't explain anything and what I was telling her is not possible. You can imagine that I could not get any sleep after that. I went down to Reception at about 09.00 am on 22nd March asking the Receptionist ( a man this time) to speak to the Manager. He told me that the Manager is not there and he is not going to be in till next day. I asked for the Duty Manager or someone else in charge and I was told there is no Duty Manager. He was fully aware of the situation, as the night Receptionist informed him about my complaint. He was absolutely not interested telling me that he can't do anything. I told him that using the card-keys he can print a report to check what key was used to open my room at 05.45 am and I offered myself to show him how to do it in case he did not know, because this is a general system used by the all hotels and as I mentioned before I work in Hotels for more then 9 years. Then he said that is not possible. At this point I was very frustrated and I asked him '' do you really think that I am telling you lies'' and I could not believe it when he answered '' YES''. I was fuming and I was on the verge of punching him. I told him that I would like to be contacted by the Manager as soon as he will be in the building. No manager contacted me. The same Receptionist was on duty when I checked out and again he showed a dreadful customer service, talking to a taxi driver during the whole check-out process, not even ''have a nice day'' or just ''good by''. It was appalling. This is the worst customer service I have ever experienced. On the 02nd May I will be going again to Madrid for couple of nights, but I will not stay at the Tirol Hotel even they will pay me to.

Reviews.Title: “Free wirelss internet in Europe!”
Reviews.Author: GovBizzTraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel while visiting the University of Madrid. It's very convenient to it, only two subway stops away. Other than that, there was not anything very interesting about the area, although there were plenty of shops and restaurants around. One big advantage of the hotel is that they offered free wireless internet on the ground floor, and there was a nice room with a big table you could go into to use your laptop. The wireless access was very high quality, too. There was also the usual outrageously expensive wireless access in the guest rooms, although it was a service that at least gave you the choice of what provider you wanted to be gouged by. My room was comfortable and reasonably sized. The walls were a little thin, and I often heard noises from the next rooms. But otherwise than it was quiet. Breakfast was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away - Bag stolen/missing from room.”
Reviews.Author: spursman1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel to experience the new year festivities in Madrid (which were great by the way !). However, we left a bag on our bed during the 1st day we were at the hotel and when we returned in the evening the bag (containing a camera, return train tickets and various other presents) was no longer in the room. We reported the matter to the hotel who were less than useful. When we finally spoke to the Manager he basically accused us of making the whole thing up. We have reported the matter to the police in Madrid (who were very helpful). Madrid is a great City but I'd advise you not to stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gezginci
Reviews.Content: This was a dreadful hotel. There was a door between our room and next room. We could hear every single noise from the next room. People in the next room talked till the morning on the first night. The second morning we woke up with a loud TV noise from next door again in the very early morning. If you do not want to sleep, then this please is ok. Otherwise it is waste of money. The only good thing was the location.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Tirol - Ok”
Reviews.Author: Gonk
Reviews.Content: This was the second time I've used this hotel, I find it a nice, quiet 3 star hotel. Reception staff all speak English, breakfast buffet is ok. Air con was not working when I went, but some hotels don't have it on until the hot weather arrives. Room was nice and clean, good bathroom with a large shower, plenty of towels etc. Irish bar nearby is Finbars, very friendly. Nearest metro is Arguelles, although you can walk to most places as the hotel is just off Gran Via. Average nightly price for a double room with bfast was £73 approx. Hotel happy to keep your luggage until your departure time as well. Ian

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value For Money”
Reviews.Author: ggertie
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very clean and decorated quite modern, however, I think we were in the modernised part of it - so if you go ask to stay in the updated side of the hotel. This hotel was quite small, it didnt have a bar but a couple of doors down was a pub - this was a perfect meeting place for us girlies, as we were on a Hen Weekend. The hotel was situated in the business district of Madrid, it was right on top of all the shops - Zara, Mango etc. To walk to Sol sqaure it took a good half an hour stroll, however there is an excellent metro service (so my friends told me, I didnt get the chance to use it) and I think it costs 1 euro for an all day ticket. Sol has a lovely square to visit with a cosmpolitan feel, I would recommend it for lunch and a beer after shopping, sightseeing. For the evening I would go to other parts of Madrid - we made the mistake of eating in Sol, and I thought it was over priced. We ate in Seville, we found a restaurant picked from the Lonley Planet Guide to Madrid - which is an excellent resource. From the airport, it cost all of us girlies different prices to get to the hotel, so maybe ask the driver "how much" before you ride. I think it was around 30 Euro. My friends used the Metro which only cost 1 Euro, and apparantly it goes directly from the airport and stops just around the corner from the hotel. Anyway, Ive digressed. This hotel is extremely good, good value for money, a cold buffet breakfast was included, which was very fresh. If I had to moan about anything it would be, the coffee out of the machine was yuk, a twix was £2 and our air conditioning in our room didnt work, but apart from that it was cool. Oh just as a by the by - as a tourist do not take for granted that the Spanish speak English, most spanish people did not, so read up on your phrases befor you go. Adios xx

Reviews.Title: “Stay away”
Reviews.Author: sinoko896
Reviews.Content: Airconditioning doesnt work. So with open windows you can hear the street sweepers at 2:30 in the morning! The receptionist for the night shift was very rude. Avoid this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Exiled_Angel
Reviews.Content: I was really pleased with this hotel. It's about 25 mins (30 euros with luggage) from the airport though you can catch the Metro easily, it's the last stop on the brown line - Arguelle (pronounced Argwell). The rooms were spacious, clean, bright, stylishly colourful and comfortable. We had a balcony with a street view and a spacious bathroom with a window looking out onto the balcony for a wonderfully cooling breeze. The hotel itself is well placed for the shopping, in fact we spent all saturday (and more money than I could really have afforded) merely walking less than 50 metres up one street. I'm told we barely scratched the surface, so if you stay here, be prepared to leave with your purse lightened! There are several Zaras on the Martin de los Heros street to the left of the cross roads that Hotel Tirol sits on and apparently all are slightly different. If you walk up this road be sure to pop into the shop under the arch on the right hand side if the road - it looks like it might house a museum or gallery but as our last shop and the most cheap and most stylish we wished we'd found it first! I'm told there are shops up every road on the crossroads, and also a great place in the shopping centre on the corner which houses a mixture of expensive designer and cheap chic. I don't know what the food was like at the hotel, though friends were a tad annoyed to find the breakfast was not included and incurred a 10 euro charge which they didn't feel was worth it. Just 5 doors down from Tirol is an irish styled pub sometimes with live bands, and almost next door is a cash machine which was very handy. I didn't have much call to speak to the staff much but when I did he was helpful (knowing my room number without me having spoken to him before) and english speaking. There are many bars and restaurants nearby or catch a cab (about 6 euros) to the livelier part of town. Of the other places nearby friends were disappointed by the nearest cafe/restaurant futher down the Calle del Marques de Urquijo. The food was apparently mediocre and they paid well over the odds for it. There was a fabulous argentinian steak restaurant further along the road right near the park which we ate at one evening, though we suspect it is more popular with the locals as you wouldn't necessarily notice it during the day and as a british hen party we attracted some curiosity. A friend from Jersey claims they are the best steaks anywhere though. And a meal for 10 people including 8-10 bottles of cava and more food than we could shake a stick at came to 35 euros each! Take an open top bus tour if you want to see a bit more of Madrid but don't expect the headphones to be very informative or to work all the time. They are temperamental to say the least. We also went to several clubs in the lively part of town, the name of which I don't know but according to a card I have much of it is on La Escalinata (road). The best club was by far was The Palace, which has to be seen to be believed. Drinks were expensive (9 euros each for a spirit + free mixer) We then bar-hopped down the road taking advantage of the cheap drinks and entry offered by the touts. At least two I don't know the name of but we had a wonderful time in all of them. Make sure you have enough for a cab back though as it is a long walk home to Tirol! On the second night we were booked to see a flamenco show at a tapas bar in the flamenco part of town. The taxi driver informed us that the show was performed by the local gypsies and was the best in town (Casa Patas) and that after midnight the gypsies are all out dancing in the street. The show was wonderful, and the atmosphere brilliant so do try and go. Tickets priced around 30 euros for entry and a drink, food and drinks gets a bit expensive after that and the whole hour and a half experience cost about 55 euros in total which seemed a bit steep though worth it. We would recommend eating elsewhere before or after. Around that part of town also apparently is a massive street market which sounded wonderful but we didn't have time to go unfortunately. Basically, we had a wonderful time and felt that the hotel was well placed for everything. We could have taken the Metro had we wanted to save cash but with 9 of us it made sense to catch taxis and share the cost. If I go back to Madrid I would definitely stay there again.
